# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(str::String; text_width::Int = 10)
    lines = []
    for word in split(str)
        if length(word) > text_width || (length(word) + length(join(lines, "")) >= text_width)
            push!(lines, "")
        end
        push!(lines, word)
    end
    return join(lines, "\n")
end

# Example usage:
str = "Hello there this is a very long sentence that should be wrapped at 10 characters per line."
println(wrap_string(str))
```

This function will output the following, wrapping each line at 10 characters (including spaces):

```
Hello
there
this
is
a
very
long
sentence
that
should
be
wrapped
at
10
characters
per
line.
```
